metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6250 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the ISO9660 writer in libarchive before 3.2.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or execute arbitrary code via vectors related to verifying filename lengths when writing an ISO9660 archive, which trigger a buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6250` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bsdcpio - 3.1.2-11ubuntu0.16.04.3
bsdtar - 3.1.2-11ubuntu0.16.04.3
libarchive13 - 3.1.2-11ubuntu0.16.04.3
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Christian Wressnegger, Alwin Maier, and Fabian Yamaguchi

criterions.comment: libarchive package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.1.2-11ubuntu0.16.04.3').
